Section 2:
Prevention & Response to Emergencies Due to Food & Allergic Reactions

The next topic to be discussed is Prevention and Response to Emergencies Due to Food & Allergic Reactions. Let’s take a closer look at food allergies.

Definitions

There are common definitions relating to food allergies and we will cover a few of those here. Select each of the cards below to learn each definition. 

Food Allergy

A Food Allergy is an adverse effect when the immune system overreacts to a harmless food protein.

Food Intolerance

Food Intolerance is when the body does not tolerate certain foods. Food intolerance is not life-threatening.

Allergen

An allergen is recognized by an individual when the food they eat causes an allergic reaction.

Anaphylaxis

Anaphylaxis is a life-threatening allergic reaction that affects the entire body.

The job of the body’s immune system is to identify and destroy germs that make you sick. With a food allergy the immune system overreacts to a food item. Food allergies and food intolerances are not the same. A food intolerance can cause some of the mild stomach symptoms of food allergies, but they are not potentially fatal.
